pages.text: Carduispongia pedicula comes from the Middle Silurian, with fossils found in the Coalbrookdale Formation, England (United Kingdom). It is a small ovoid-shaped reticulosan sponge, with many large prostalia protruding from the body, growing up to 1 cm in height. The generic name derives from the Latin words 'Carduus', to mean 'thistle'; and 'spongia', to mean 'sponge'. The specific name derives from the Latin word 'pediculus', to mean 'louse'.
